Verse 1: <<By David; when he pretended to be insane before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed.Psalm 34 is an acrostic poem, with each verse starting with a letter of the alphabet (ordered from Alef to Tav).>> I will bless Yahweh at all times. Verse 2: My soul shall boast in Yahweh. The humble shall hear of it, and be glad.᛫Verse 2: My soul shall make her boast in the LORD: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.
Verse 3: Oh magnify Yahweh with me. Let us exalt his name together.᛫Verse 3: O magnify the LORD with me, and let us exalt his name together.

Verse 12: He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, "We never saw anything like this!"᛫Verse 12: And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.
Verse 4: I sought Yahweh, and he answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.᛫Verse 4: I sought the LORD, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
Verse 5: They looked to him, and were radiant. Their faces shall never be covered with shame.᛫Verse 5: They looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.
Verse 6: This poor man cried, and Yahweh heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.᛫Verse 6: This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
Verse 7: The angel of Yahweh encamps around those who fear him, and delivers them.᛫Verse 7: The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.
Verse 8: Oh taste and see that Yahweh is good. Blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.᛫Verse 8: O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.

Verse 13: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.᛫Verse 13: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.
Verse 9: Oh fear Yahweh, you his saints, for there is no lack with those who fear him.᛫Verse 9: O fear the LORD, ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.

Verse 10: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger, but those who seek Yahweh shall not lack any good thing.᛫Verse 10: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the LORD shall not want any good thing.
Verse 11: Come, you children, listen to me. I will teach you the fear of Yahweh.᛫Verse 11: Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
Verse 12: Who is someone who desires life, and loves many days, that he may see good?᛫Verse 12: What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?
Verse 13: Keep your tongue from evil, and your lips from speaking lies.᛫Verse 13: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
Verse 14: Depart from evil, and do good. seek peace, and pursue it.᛫Verse 14: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

Verse 14: As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, "Follow me." And he arose and followed him.᛫Verse 14: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
Verse 15: Yahweh's eyes are toward the righteous. His ears listen to their cry.᛫Verse 15: The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.

Verse 16: Yahweh's face is against those who do evil, to cut off their memory from the earth.᛫Verse 16: The face of the LORD is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
Verse 17: The righteous cry, and Yahweh hears, and delivers them out of all their troubles.᛫Verse 17: The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

Verse 18: Yahweh is near to those who have a broken heart, and saves those who have a crushed spirit.᛫Verse 18: The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.
Verse 19: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but Yahweh delivers him out of them all.᛫Verse 19: Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the LORD delivereth him out of them all.
Verse 20: He protects all of his bones. Not one of them is broken.᛫Verse 20: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
Verse 21: Evil shall kill the wicked. Those who hate the righteous shall be condemned.᛫Verse 21: Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.

Verse 22: Yahweh redeems the soul of his servants. None of those who take refuge in him shall be condemned.᛫Verse 22: The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.
Verse 1: <<For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.>> Yahweh, you have searched me, and you know me.᛫Verse 1: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.

Verse 15: It happened, that he was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.᛫Verse 15: And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.
Verse 2: You know my sitting down and my rising up. You perceive my thoughts from afar.᛫Verse 2: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.
Verse 3: You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.᛫Verse 3: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
Verse 4: For there is not a word on my tongue, but, behold, Yahweh, you know it altogether.᛫Verse 4: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.
Verse 5: You hem me in behind and before. You laid your hand on me.᛫Verse 5: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
Verse 6: This knowledge is beyond me. It's lofty. I can't attain it.᛫Verse 6: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
Verse 7: Where could I go from your Spirit? Or where could I flee from your presence?᛫Verse 7: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

Verse 8: If I ascend up into heaven, you are there. If I make my bed in Sheol , behold, you are there!᛫Verse 8: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
Verse 9: If I take the wings of the dawn, and settle in the uttermost parts of the sea;᛫Verse 9: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
Verse 10: Even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.᛫Verse 10: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
Verse 11: If I say, "Surely the darkness will overwhelm me; the light around me will be night";᛫Verse 11: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

Verse 16: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, "Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?"᛫Verse 16: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?

Verse 12: even the darkness doesn't hide from you, but the night shines as the day. The darkness is like light to you.᛫Verse 12: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
Verse 13: For you formed my inmost being. You knit me together in my mother's womb.᛫Verse 13: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

Verse 14: I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Your works are wonderful. My soul knows that very well.᛫Verse 14: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

Verse 9: Then Jesus said to them, "I will ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?"᛫Verse 9: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?

Verse 15: My frame wasn't hidden from you, when I was made in secret, woven together in the depths of the earth.᛫Verse 15: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

Verse 16: Your eyes saw my body. In your book they were all written, the days that were ordained for me, when as yet there were none of them.᛫Verse 16: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
Verse 17: How precious to me are your thoughts, God! How vast is their sum!᛫Verse 17: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

Verse 18: If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand. When I wake up, I am still with you.᛫Verse 18: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
Verse 19: If only you, God, would kill the wicked. Get away from me, you bloodthirsty men!᛫Verse 19: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
Verse 20: For they speak against you wickedly. Your enemies take your name in vain.᛫Verse 20: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

Verse 21: Yahweh, don't I hate those who hate you? Am I not grieved with those who rise up against you?᛫Verse 21: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
Verse 22: I hate them with perfect hatred. They have become my enemies.᛫Verse 22: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

Verse 17: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, "Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."᛫Verse 17: When Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
Verse 23: Search me, God, and know my heart. Try me, and know my thoughts.᛫Verse 23: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
Verse 24: See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the everlasting way.᛫Verse 24: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
Verse 1: <<A Song of Ascents.>> I will lift up my eyes to the hills. Where does my help come from?᛫Verse 1: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.
Verse 2: My help comes from Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.᛫Verse 2: My help cometh from the LORD, which made heaven and earth.
Verse 3: He will not allow your foot to be moved. He who keeps you will not slumber.᛫Verse 3: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.
Verse 4: Behold, he who keeps Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.᛫Verse 4: Behold, he that keepeth Israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.
Verse 22: For the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was more than forty years old.᛫Verse 22: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.

Verse 18: John's disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him, "Why do John's disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don't fast?"᛫Verse 18: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
Verse 5: Yahweh is your keeper. Yahweh is your shade on your right hand.᛫Verse 5: The LORD is thy keeper: the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.
Verse 6: The sun will not harm you by day, nor the moon by night.᛫Verse 6: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
Verse 7: Yahweh will keep you from all evil. He will keep your soul.᛫Verse 7: The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.

Verse 8: Yahweh will keep your going out and your coming in, from this time forth, and forevermore.᛫Verse 8: The LORD shall preserve thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even for evermore.

Verse 1: <<By David.>> Yahweh is my light and my salvation. Whom shall I fear? Yahweh is the strength of my life. Of whom shall I be afraid?᛫Verse 1: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

Verse 2: When evildoers came at me to eat up my flesh, even my adversaries and my foes, they stumbled and fell.᛫Verse 2: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

Verse 3: Though an army should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear. Though war should rise against me, even then I will be confident.᛫Verse 3: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

Verse 4: One thing I have asked of Yahweh, that I will seek after, that I may dwell in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life, to see Yahweh's beauty, and to inquire in his temple.᛫Verse 4: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to inquire in his temple.

Verse 5: For in the day of trouble he will keep me secretly in his pavilion. In the covert of his tabernacle he will hide me. He will lift me up on a rock.᛫Verse 5: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

Verse 6: Now my head will be lifted up above my enemies around me. I will offer sacrifices of joy in his tent. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to Yahweh.᛫Verse 6: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.

Verse 19: Jesus said to them, "Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can't fast.᛫Verse 19: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
Verse 7: Hear, Yahweh, when I cry with my voice. Have mercy also on me, and answer me.᛫Verse 7: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
Verse 8: When you said, "Seek my face," my heart said to you, "I will seek your face, Yahweh."᛫Verse 8: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.

Verse 9: Don't hide your face from me. Don't put your servant away in anger. You have been my help. Don't abandon me, neither forsake me, God of my salvation.᛫Verse 9: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
Verse 10: When my father and my mother forsake me, then Yahweh will take me up.᛫Verse 10: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.

Verse 20: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.᛫Verse 20: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.
Verse 11: Teach me your way, Yahweh. Lead me in a straight path, because of my enemies.᛫Verse 11: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

Verse 12: Don't deliver me over to the desire of my adversaries, for false witnesses have risen up against me, such as breathe out cruelty.᛫Verse 12: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

Verse 46: He said to them, "Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,᛫Verse 46: And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:

Verse 13: I am still confident of this: I will see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living.᛫Verse 13: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.

Verse 21: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.᛫Verse 21: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment: else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old, and the rent is made worse.

Verse 14: Wait for Yahweh. Be strong, and let your heart take courage. Yes, wait for Yahweh.᛫Verse 14: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
Verse 1: <<For the Chief Musician. To Jeduthan. A Psalm by David.>> My soul rests in God alone. My salvation is from him.᛫Verse 1: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
Verse 2: He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress-- I will never be greatly shaken.᛫Verse 2: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.

Verse 3: How long will you assault a man, would all of you throw him down, Like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?᛫Verse 3: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.

Verse 4: They fully intend to throw him down from his lofty place. They delight in lies. They bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.᛫Verse 4: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

Verse 22: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins."᛫Verse 22: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: else the new wine doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.
Verse 5: My soul, wait in silence for God alone, for my expectation is from him.᛫Verse 5: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
Verse 6: He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress. I will not be shaken.᛫Verse 6: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
Verse 7: With God is my salvation and my honor. The rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.᛫Verse 7: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.

Verse 8: Trust in him at all times, you people. Pour out your heart before him. God is a refuge for us. Selah.᛫Verse 8: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.

Verse 9: Surely men of low degree are just a breath, and men of high degree are a lie. In the balances they will go up. They are together lighter than a breath.᛫Verse 9: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.

Verse 10: Don't trust in oppression. Don't become vain in robbery. If riches increase, don't set your heart on them.᛫Verse 10: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

Verse 23: It happened that he was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.᛫Verse 23: And it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.
Verse 11: God has spoken once; twice I have heard this, that power belongs to God.᛫Verse 11: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.

Verse 12: Also to you, Lord, belongs loving kindness, for you reward every man according to his work.᛫Verse 12: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.

Verse 1: <<By David.>> Don't fret because of evildoers, neither be envious against those who work unrighteousness.᛫Verse 1: Fret not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.
Verse 2: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither like the green herb.᛫Verse 2: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.
Verse 3: Trust in Yahweh, and do good. Dwell in the land, and enjoy safe pasture.᛫Verse 3: Trust in the LORD, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.
Verse 4: Also delight yourself in Yahweh, and he will give you the desires of your heart.᛫Verse 4: Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
Verse 5: Commit your way to Yahweh. Trust also in him, and he will do this:᛫Verse 5: Commit thy way unto the LORD; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.

Verse 24: The Pharisees said to him, "Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?"᛫Verse 24: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?

Verse 6: he will make your righteousness go forth as the light, and your justice as the noon day sun.᛫Verse 6: And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

Verse 7: Rest in Yahweh, and wait patiently for him. Don't fret because of him who prospers in his way, because of the man who makes wicked plots happen.᛫Verse 7: Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

Verse 47: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.᛫Verse 47: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

Verse 25: He said to them, "Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry--he, and those who were with him?᛫Verse 25: And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was an hungred, he, and they that were with him?
Verse 8: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath. Don't fret, it leads only to evildoing.᛫Verse 8: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.

Verse 9: For evildoers shall be cut off, but those who wait for Yahweh shall inherit the land.᛫Verse 9: For evildoers shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the LORD, they shall inherit the earth.

Verse 10: For yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more. Yes, though you look for his place, he isn't there.᛫Verse 10: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.

Verse 11: But the humble shall inherit the land, and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.᛫Verse 11: But the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
Verse 12: The wicked plots against the just, and gnashes at him with his teeth.᛫Verse 12: The wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.
Verse 13: The Lord will laugh at him, for he sees that his day is coming.᛫Verse 13: The Lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming.

Verse 26: How he entered into God's house when Abiathar was high priest, and ate the show bread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?"᛫Verse 26: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and did eat the shewbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to them which were with him?

Verse 14: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, to kill those who are upright in the way.᛫Verse 14: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.
Verse 15: Their sword shall enter into their own heart. Their bows shall be broken.᛫Verse 15: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
Verse 48: You are witnesses of these things.᛫Verse 48: And ye are witnesses of these things.
Verse 16: Better is a little that the righteous has, than the abundance of many wicked.᛫Verse 16: A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.
Verse 17: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, but Yahweh upholds the righteous.᛫Verse 17: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the LORD upholdeth the righteous.
Verse 27: He said to them, "The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.᛫Verse 27: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
Verse 18: Yahweh knows the days of the perfect. Their inheritance shall be forever.᛫Verse 18: The LORD knoweth the days of the upright: and their inheritance shall be for ever.

Verse 19: They shall not be disappointed in the time of evil. In the days of famine they shall be satisfied.᛫Verse 19: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time: and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

Verse 20: But the wicked shall perish. The enemies of Yahweh shall be like the beauty of the fields. They will vanish-- vanish like smoke.᛫Verse 20: But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.

Verse 23: Being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.᛫Verse 23: And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.
Verse 28: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath."᛫Verse 28: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
Verse 21: The wicked borrow, and don't pay back, but the righteous give generously.᛫Verse 21: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.

Verse 22: For such as are blessed by him shall inherit the land. Those who are cursed by him shall be cut off.᛫Verse 22: For such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be cut off.
Verse 23: A man's goings are established by Yahweh. He delights in his way.᛫Verse 23: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD: and he delighteth in his way.
Verse 24: Though he stumble, he shall not fall, for Yahweh holds him up with his hand.᛫Verse 24: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the LORD upholdeth him with his hand.

Verse 25: I have been young, and now am old, yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his children begging for bread.᛫Verse 25: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.

Verse 1: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.᛫Verse 1: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.
Verse 26: All day long he deals graciously, and lends. His seed is blessed.᛫Verse 26: He is ever merciful, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.

Verse 35: This I say for your own profit; not that I may ensnare you, but for that which is appropriate, and that you may attend to the Lord without distraction.᛫Verse 35: And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon the Lord without distraction.

Verse 36: But if any man thinks that he is behaving inappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the flower of her age, and if need so requires, let him do what he desires. He doesn't sin. Let them marry.᛫Verse 36: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.

Verse 37: But he who stands steadfast in his heart, having no necessity, but has power over his own heart, to keep his own virgin, does well.᛫Verse 37: Nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in his heart, having no necessity, but hath power over his own will, and hath so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, doeth well.

Verse 38: So then both he who gives his own virgin in marriage does well, and he who doesn't give her in marriage does better.᛫Verse 38: So then he that giveth her in marriage doeth well; but he that giveth her not in marriage doeth better.

Verse 39: A wife is bound by law for as long as her husband lives; but if the husband is dead, she is free to be married to whomever she desires, only in the Lord.᛫Verse 39: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

Verse 40: But she is happier if she stays as she is, in my judgment, and I think that I also have God's Spirit.᛫Verse 40: But she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.

Verse 1: Now concerning things sacrificed to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.᛫Verse 1: Now as touching things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.
Verse 2: But if anyone thinks that he knows anything, he doesn't yet know as he ought to know.᛫Verse 2: And if any man think that he knoweth anything, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.

Verse 7: Therefore I didn't even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.᛫Verse 7: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.
Verse 3: But if anyone loves God, the same is known by him.᛫Verse 3: But if any man love God, the same is known of him.

Verse 4: Therefore concerning the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that no idol is anything in the world, and that there is no other God but one.᛫Verse 4: As concerning therefore the eating of those things that are offered in sacrifice unto idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is none other God but one.

Verse 5: For though there are things that are called "gods," whether in the heavens or on earth; as there are many "gods" and many "lords";᛫Verse 5: For though there be that are called gods, whether in heaven or in earth, (as there be gods many, and lords many,)

Verse 6: yet to us there is one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we for him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we live through him.᛫Verse 6: But to us there is but one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.

Verse 7: However, that knowledge isn't in all men. But some, with consciousness of the idol until now, eat as of a thing sacrificed to an idol, and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.᛫Verse 7: Howbeit there is not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat it as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

Verse 8: But food will not commend us to God. For neither, if we don't eat, are we the worse; nor, if we eat, are we the better.᛫Verse 8: But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither, if we eat, are we the better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.

Verse 9: But be careful that by no means does this liberty of yours become a stumbling block to the weak.᛫Verse 9: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours become a stumblingblock to them that are weak.

Verse 10: For if a man sees you who have knowledge sitting in an idol's temple, won't his conscience, if he is weak, be emboldened to eat things sacrificed to idols?᛫Verse 10: For if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idol's temple, shall not the conscience of him which is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols;
Verse 11: And through your knowledge, he who is weak perishes, the brother for whose sake Christ died.᛫Verse 11: And through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?
Verse 11: They asked him, saying, "Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?"᛫Verse 11: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?

Verse 12: Thus, sinning against the brothers, and wounding their conscience when it is weak, you sin against Christ.᛫Verse 12: But when ye sin so against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.

Verse 13: Therefore if food causes my brother to stumble, I will eat no meat forevermore, that I don't cause my brother to stumble.᛫Verse 13: Wherefore, if meat make my brother to offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth, lest I make my brother to offend.

Verse 1: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Haven't I seen Jesus Christ, our Lord? Aren't you my work in the Lord?᛫Verse 1: Am I not an apostle? am I not free? have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? are not ye my work in the Lord?

Verse 2: If to others I am not an apostle, yet at least I am to you; for you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.᛫Verse 2: If I be not an apostle unto others, yet doubtless I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.
Verse 3: My defense to those who examine me is this.᛫Verse 3: Mine answer to them that do examine me is this,
Verse 4: Have we no right to eat and to drink?᛫Verse 4: Have we not power to eat and to drink?

Verse 5: Have we no right to take along a wife who is a believer, even as the rest of the apostles, and the brothers of the Lord, and Cephas?᛫Verse 5: Have we not power to lead about a sister, a wife, as well as other apostles, and as the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?
Verse 6: Or have only Barnabas and I no right to not work?᛫Verse 6: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

Verse 12: He said to them, "Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?᛫Verse 12: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
Verse 8: Do I speak these things according to the ways of men? Or doesn't the law also say the same thing?᛫Verse 8: Say I these things as a man? or saith not the law the same also?

Verse 9: For it is written in the law of Moses, "You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain." Is it for the oxen that God cares,᛫Verse 9: For it is written in the law of Moses, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn. Doth God take care for oxen?

Verse 10: or does he say it assuredly for our sake? Yes, it was written for our sake, because he who plows ought to plow in hope, and he who threshes in hope should partake of his hope.᛫Verse 10: Or saith he it altogether for our sakes? For our sakes, no doubt, this is written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of his hope.

Verse 11: If we sowed to you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we reap your fleshly things?᛫Verse 11: If we have sown unto you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?

Verse 12: If others partake of this right over you, don't we yet more? Nevertheless we did not use this right, but we bear all things, that we may cause no hindrance to the Good News of Christ.᛫Verse 12: If others be partakers of this power over you, are not we rather? Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.

Verse 13: Don't you know that those who serve around sacred things eat from the things of the temple, and those who wait on the altar have their portion with the altar?᛫Verse 13: Do ye not know that they which minister about holy things live of the things of the temple? and they which wait at the alter are partakers with the alter?

Verse 14: Even so the Lord ordained that those who proclaim the Good News should live from the Good News.᛫Verse 14: Even so hath the Lord ordained that they which preach the gospel should live of the gospel.

Verse 15: But I have used none of these things, and I don't write these things that it may be done so in my case; for I would rather die, than that anyone should make my boasting void.᛫Verse 15: But I have used none of these things: neither have I written these things, that it should be so done unto me: for it were better for me to die, than that any man should make my glorying void.

Verse 16: For if I preach the Good News, I have nothing to boast about; for necessity is laid on me; but woe is to me, if I don't preach the Good News.᛫Verse 16: For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!

Verse 13: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him."᛫Verse 13: But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.

Verse 17: For if I do this of my own will, I have a reward. But if not of my own will, I have a stewardship entrusted to me.᛫Verse 17: For if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward: but if against my will, a dispensation of the gospel is committed unto me.

Verse 18: What then is my reward? That, when I preach the Good News, I may present the Good News of Christ without charge, so as not to abuse my authority in the Good News.᛫Verse 18: What is my reward then? Verily that, when I preach the gospel, I may make the gospel of Christ without charge, that I abuse not my power in the gospel.

Verse 19: For though I was free from all, I brought myself under bondage to all, that I might gain the more.᛫Verse 19: For though I be free from all men, yet have I made myself servant unto all, that I might gain the more.

Verse 21: to those who are without law, as without law (not being without law toward God, but under law toward Christ), that I might win those who are without law.᛫Verse 21: To them that are without law, as without law, (being not without law to God, but under the law to Christ,) that I might gain them that are without law.

Verse 14: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.᛫Verse 14: And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.

Verse 22: To the weak I became as weak, that I might gain the weak. I have become all things to all men, that I may by all means save some.᛫Verse 22: To the weak became I as weak, that I might gain the weak: I am made all things to all men, that I might by all means save some.
Verse 23: Now I do this for the sake of the Good News, that I may be a joint partaker of it.᛫Verse 23: And this I do for the gospel's sake, that I might be partaker thereof with you.

Verse 24: Don't you know that those who run in a race all run, but one receives the prize? Run like that, that you may win.᛫Verse 24: Know ye not that they which run in a race run all, but one receiveth the prize? So run, that ye may obtain.

Verse 25: Every man who strives in the games exercises self-control in all things. Now they do it to receive a corruptible crown, but we an incorruptible.᛫Verse 25: And every man that striveth for the mastery is temperate in all things. Now they do it to obtain a corruptible crown; but we an incorruptible.
Verse 26: I therefore run like that, as not uncertainly. I fight like that, as not beating the air,᛫Verse 26: I therefore so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one that beateth the air:

Verse 27: but I beat my body and bring it into submission, lest by any means, after I have preached to others, I myself should be rejected.᛫Verse 27: But I keep under my body, and bring it into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.
Verse 2: and were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea;᛫Verse 2: And were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;
Verse 3: and all ate the same spiritual food;᛫Verse 3: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

Verse 15: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him greeted him.᛫Verse 15: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.

Verse 4: and all drank the same spiritual drink. For they drank of a spiritual rock that followed them, and the rock was Christ.᛫Verse 4: And did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them: and that Rock was Christ.

Verse 5: However with most of them, God was not well pleased, for they were overthrown in the wilderness.᛫Verse 5: But with many of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the wilderness.

Verse 6: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.᛫Verse 6: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

Verse 7: Neither be idolaters, as some of them were. As it is written, "The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play."᛫Verse 7: Neither be ye idolaters, as were some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

Verse 8: Neither let us commit sexual immorality, as some of them committed, and in one day twenty-three thousand fell.᛫Verse 8: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.
Verse 9: Neither let us test the Lord, as some of them tested, and perished by the serpents.᛫Verse 9: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed of serpents.
Verse 10: Neither grumble, as some of them also grumbled, and perished by the destroyer.᛫Verse 10: Neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured, and were destroyed of the destroyer.

Verse 11: Now all these things happened to them by way of example, and they were written for our admonition, on whom the ends of the ages have come.᛫Verse 11: Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come.
Verse 12: Therefore let him who thinks he stands be careful that he doesn't fall.᛫Verse 12: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

Verse 13: No temptation has taken you except what is common to man. God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted above what you are able, but will with the temptation also make the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.᛫Verse 13: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.
Verse 16: He asked the scribes, "What are you asking them?"᛫Verse 16: And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?
Verse 14: Therefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.᛫Verse 14: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.
Verse 15: I speak as to wise men. Judge what I say.᛫Verse 15: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.

The bread which we break, isn't it a sharing of the body of Christ?᛫Verse 16: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?

Verse 17: Because there is one loaf of bread, we, who are many, are one body; for we all partake of the one loaf of bread.᛫Verse 17: For we being many are one bread, and one body: for we are all partakers of that one bread.

Verse 18: Consider Israel according to the flesh. Don't those who eat the sacrifices participate in the altar?᛫Verse 18: Behold Israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the sacrifices partakers of the alter?

Verse 19: What am I saying then? That a thing sacrificed to idols is anything, or that an idol is anything?᛫Verse 19: What say I then? that the idol is any thing, or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is any thing?

Verse 20: But I say that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons, and not to God, and I don't desire that you would have fellowship with demons.᛫Verse 20: But I say, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God: and I would not that ye should have fellowship with devils.

Verse 22: Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than he?᛫Verse 22: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?

Verse 13: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.᛫Verse 13: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.

Verse 17: One of the multitude answered, "Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit;᛫Verse 17: And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;
Verse 24: Let no one seek his own, but each one his neighbor's good.᛫Verse 24: Let no man seek his own, but every man another's wealth.
Verse 25: Whatever is sold in the butcher shop, eat, asking no question for the sake of conscience,᛫Verse 25: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, that eat, asking no question for conscience sake:
Verse 26: for "the earth is the Lord's, and its fullness."᛫Verse 26: For the earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof.

Verse 27: But if one of those who don't believe invites you to a meal, and you are inclined to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no questions for the sake of conscience.᛫Verse 27: If any of them that believe not bid you to a feast, and ye be disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you, eat, asking no question for conscience sake.

Verse 28: But if anyone says to you, "This was offered to idols," don't eat it for the sake of the one who told you, and for the sake of conscience. For "the earth is the Lord's, and all its fullness."᛫Verse 28: But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof:

Verse 29: Conscience, I say, not your own, but the other's conscience. For why is my liberty judged by another conscience?᛫Verse 29: Conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other: for why is my liberty judged of another man's conscience?
Verse 30: If I partake with thankfulness, why am I denounced for that for which I give thanks?᛫Verse 30: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?
Verse 31: Whether therefore you eat, or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.᛫Verse 31: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
Verse 32: Give no occasions for stumbling, either to Jews, or to Greeks, or to the assembly of God;᛫Verse 32: Give none offence, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God:

Verse 33: even as I also please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of the many, that they may be saved.᛫Verse 33: Even as I please all men in all things, not seeking mine own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.

Verse 18: and wherever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth, and wastes away. I asked your disciples to cast it out, and they weren't able."᛫Verse 18: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.
Verse 1: Be imitators of me, even as I also am of Christ.᛫Verse 1: Be ye followers of me, even as I also am of Christ.

Verse 3: But I would have you know that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is the man, and the head of Christ is God.᛫Verse 3: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.
Verse 4: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonors his head.᛫Verse 4: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonoureth his head.

Verse 5: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head unveiled dishonors her head. For it is one and the same thing as if she were shaved.᛫Verse 5: But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.

Verse 6: For if a woman is not covered, let her also be shorn. But if it is shameful for a woman to be shorn or shaved, let her be covered.᛫Verse 6: For if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

Verse 7: For a man indeed ought not to have his head covered, because he is the image and glory of God, but the woman is the glory of the man.᛫Verse 7: For a man indeed ought not to cover his head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.
Verse 8: For man is not from woman, but woman from man;᛫Verse 8: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.
Verse 9: for neither was man created for the woman, but woman for the man.᛫Verse 9: Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.
Verse 10: For this cause the woman ought to have authority on her head, because of the angels.᛫Verse 10: For this cause ought the woman to have power on her head because of the angels.

Verse 19: He answered him, "Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me."᛫Verse 19: He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.

Verse 11: Nevertheless, neither is the woman independent of the man, nor the man independent of the woman, in the Lord.᛫Verse 11: Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.

Verse 12: For as woman came from man, so a man also comes through a woman; but all things are from God.᛫Verse 12: For as the woman is of the man, even so is the man also by the woman; but all things of god.
Verse 13: Judge for yourselves. Is it appropriate that a woman pray to God unveiled?᛫Verse 13: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?

Verse 14: Doesn't even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him?᛫Verse 14: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?

Verse 15: But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her, for her hair is given to her for a covering.᛫Verse 15: But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for her hair is given her for a covering.

Verse 16: But if any man seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither do God's assemblies.᛫Verse 16: But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

Verse 17: But in giving you this command, I don't praise you, that you come together not for the better but for the worse.᛫Verse 17: Now in this that I declare unto you I praise you not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.

Verse 18: For first of all, when you come together in the assembly, I hear that divisions exist among you, and I partly believe it.᛫Verse 18: For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.

Verse 19: For there also must be factions among you, that those who are approved may be revealed among you.᛫Verse 19: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.
Verse 20: When therefore you assemble yourselves together, it is not the Lord's supper that you eat.᛫Verse 20: When ye come together therefore into one place, this is not to eat the Lord's supper.

Verse 8: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, 'Go!' and he goes; and to another, 'Come!' and he comes; and to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."᛫Verse 8: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

Verse 21: For in your eating each one takes his own supper first. One is hungry, and another is drunken.᛫Verse 21: For in eating every one taketh before other his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.

Verse 23: For I received from the Lord that which also I delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus on the night in which he was betrayed took bread.᛫Verse 23: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread:

Do this, as often as you drink, in memory of me."᛫Verse 25: After the same manner also he took the cup, when he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as oft as ye drink it, in remembrance of me.

Verse 26: For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord's death until he comes.᛫Verse 26: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord's death till he come.

Verse 27: Therefore whoever eats this bread or drinks the Lord's cup in a way unworthy of the Lord will be guilty of the body and the blood of the Lord.᛫Verse 27: Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread, and drink this cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
Verse 28: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.᛫Verse 28: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of that bread, and drink of that cup.

Verse 29: For he who eats and drinks in an unworthy way eats and drinks judgment to himself, if he doesn't discern the Lord's body.᛫Verse 29: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body.
